wikipedia_page.main: Charles Vane (born William George Yarrow; 2 January 1860 – 14 April 1943) was a British stage and film actor. Vane appeared in more than fifty films during the silent era including the lead in When It Was Dark (1919).

Not Guilty is a 1919 British silent comedy crime film directed by Arrigo Bocchi and starring Kenelm Foss, Charles Vane and Hayford Hobbs.Low p.419 The screenplay concerns a barrister who takes on his own case when he has to defend himself in court for tricking a millionaire out of money for a good cause.
* Charles Vane as Sir Gregory Horne

link_mentions.page: The Man and the Moment (1918 film)
response: The Man and the Moment is a 1918 British silent drama film directed by Arrigo Bocchi and starring Manora Thew, Hayford Hobbs and Charles Vane.Low p.192 It is an adaptation of the 1914 novel of the same name by Elinor Glyn.
* Charles Vane as Lord Henry Fordyce

The Slave is a 1918 British silent crime film directed by Arrigo Bocchi and starring Jean-Marie de l'Isle, Hayford Hobbs and Charles Vane. It was based on the 1899 novel of the same name by Robert Hichens.Goble p.956
* Charles Vane as Sir Reuben Allabruth
* Charles Vane as Sir George Gillingham
Calvary is a 1920 British silent drama film directed by Edwin J. Collins and starring Malvina Longfellow, Henry Victor and Charles Vane.Palmer p.483

link_mentions.page: The Way of the World (1920 film)
response: The Way of the World is a 1920 British silent drama film directed by A. E. Coleby and starring Coleby, Gordon Coghill and Charles Vane.Palmer p.912
Charles Vane was an English pirate.
Charles Vane may also refer to:
*Charles Vane (actor) (1860–1943), British stage and film actor

Stella is a 1921 British silent drama film directed by Edwin J. Collins and starring Molly Adair, H. Manning Haynes and Charles Vane.Low p.458 It is based on the 1904 novel Stella Fregelius by H. Rider Haggard.
In 1918, it was adapted into a silent film of the same title directed by Arrigo Bocchi and starring Hayford Hobbs and Charles Vane.Goble p.222
